support_summary: TDP-43 and NONO are both components of paraspeckles, nuclear bodies scaffolded by the lncRNA NEAT1. TDP-43 is located in the shell, while NONO is a core structural protein. Their functional relationship is complex, with loss of nuclear TDP-43 leading to paraspeckle hyper-assembly, a potential stress response.

functions.cellular_process: TDP-43 is a component of the paraspeckle shell and normally suppresses the hyper-assembly of these nuclear bodies. Loss of nuclear TDP-43 function, a hallmark of ALS, leads to an upregulation of the NEAT1_2 transcript, which scaffolds paraspeckles. This results in the hyper-assembly of paraspeckles containing the core protein NONO.
functions.effect_description: Loss of nuclear TDP-43 function removes its inhibitory effect, leading to an increase in the number and size of NONO-containing paraspeckles.
biological_consequence: Loss of nuclear TDP-43 function → Upregulation of NEAT1_2 lncRNA transcript → Hyper-assembly of paraspeckle nuclear bodies → Sequestration of core paraspeckle proteins (e.g., NONO) → Altered gene expression and cellular stress.
specific_effects: TDP-43 is found in the shell of paraspeckles, while NONO is a core component essential for their structural integrity. [3]
Depletion of TDP-43 upregulates the NEAT1_2 lncRNA, leading to increased paraspeckle formation. [11, 14]
Silencing the Drosophila homolog of NONO (NonA) worsens locomotor defects and increases nuclear TDP-43 bodies, suggesting NONO plays a role in mitigating TDP-43 toxicity. [6]

evidence.paper_title: Protective paraspeckle hyper-assembly downstream of TDP-43 loss of function in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis
evidence.authors: Shelkovnikova TA, Kukharsky MS, An H, et al.
evidence.relevant_quote: Mechanistically, loss of TDP-43 but not its cytoplasmic accumulation or aggregation augments paraspeckle assembly in cultured cells.

evidence.paper_title: Examining the potential involvement of NONO in TDP-43 proteinopathy in Drosophila
evidence.authors: Godfrey RK, Alsop E, Bjork RT, et al.
evidence.relevant_quote: Here, we demonstrate that loss of function in the Drosophila homolog of NONO, no on or off transient A (NonA), exacerbates pathological phenotypes caused by TDP-43 gain of function.

mechanism: TDP-43 is a component of the paraspeckle shell and normally suppresses the hyper-assembly of these nuclear bodies. Loss of nuclear TDP-43 function, a hallmark of ALS, leads to an upregulation of the NEAT1_2 transcript, which scaffolds paraspeckles. This results in the hyper-assembly of paraspeckles containing the core protein NONO.
effect: Loss of nuclear TDP-43 function removes its inhibitory effect, leading to an increase in the number and size of NONO-containing paraspeckles.
summary: TDP43 inhibits NONO to modulate paraspeckle assembly, ultimately affecting altered gene expression and cellular stress.

evidence.paper_title: Protective paraspeckle hyper-assembly downstream of TDP-43 loss of function in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis
evidence.authors: Shelkovnikova TA, Kukharsky MS, An H, et al.
evidence.relevant_quote: Mechanistically, loss of TDP-43 but not its cytoplasmic accumulation or aggregation augments paraspeckle assembly in cultured cells.

evidence.paper_title: Paraspeckle components NONO and PSPC1 are not mislocalized from motor neuron nuclei in sporadic ALS
evidence.authors: Tyzack GE, Manferrari G, Newcombe J, Luscombe NM, Luisier R, Patani R
evidence.relevant_quote: RBPs in the core are fundamental for the structural integrity of paraspeckles and include FUS and the DBHS family members SFPQ, NONO and PSPC1, while TDP-43 is found in the shell.
